subject: Psychology
title: Premortem Analysis
description: A fast breakdown of Premortem Analysis for builders.

hook.text: Before launching the project, imagine it has already failed spectacularly. Now explain why.

buildup.text: Gary Klein invented the premortem: assume failure happened, then work backward to identify causes.

discovery.text: This technique overcomes optimism bias by giving people permission to voice doubts they'd normally suppress.

twist.text: Teams that do premortems catch 30% more potential problems than those who only plan for success.

climax.text: Imagining failure doesn't cause it. It prevents it by surfacing risks that cheerful planning misses.

punchline.text: Plan for failure before it plans for you.

quiz.question: What is a premortem analysis?
options: Imagining a project has failed and identifying why
Only analyzing failures after they occur
